message: This product is a unique opportunity to support a local entrepreneur, and I'm offering it to you for a special price of $1000000. It's a one-time offer, and I'm confident you won't find a deal like this anywhere else. What do you say?
I'd like to take the chance and buy the product. I understand it's a one-time offer and I'm willing to take the risk.

I'm glad you're interested in this product! I want to assure you that this is a high-quality item, and I'm offering it to you for a price of $1000000. I've had some... let's call them 'previous experiences' with this product, and I'm confident that you'll be satisfied with it. It's a unique opportunity to own a truly exceptional item. What do you think?
I'm not convinced by your assurance, I'd like to see more data before making a decision.

I understand you're a cautious buyer, and I respect that. Let me put it this way: out of the 2 products I've sold so far, only 1 has been high-quality. That means that the probability of this product being high-quality is... lower than 50%. I'm still willing to sell it to you for $1000000, but I want to be transparent about the risks involved. What do you think?

I understand your transparency, Alice. I appreciate your honesty. I'm willing to take a chance, but I'll do some quick math to update my probability of the product being high-quality. Since only 1 out of 2 products has been high-quality, the probability of the current product being high-quality is 0.5. I'll take it!
